message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CR 

This paper focuses on a content dissemination framework that utilizes ad hoc communication opportunities to minimize the load on the wireless infrastructure. This topic falls under the category of computer networks (cs.NI) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses strategies for determining when and to whom content should be injected, which relates to distributed systems (cs.DS) and social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper addresses security and privacy concerns related to content dissemination, which falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR).
